item.title: Changing A Master Page Body Tag’s CSS Class For Different Content Pages
item.description: It seems a bit of a failing of Master Pages that there’s no clear way to assign different CSS classes to the ‘body’ tag based on the Content Page.  To get around this, I’ve taken to inheriting all of my content pages from a known base class (which in turn inherits from System.Web.Page) and then giving it a publically accessible property of ‘BodyCssClass’! 1: namespace MartinOnDotNet.MasterPageBodyClass 2: { 3: public class BasePage : System.
